userInterface
Class BusboyUI

java.lang.Object
  userInterface.BusboyUI

public class BusboyUI
extends java.lang.Object

The BusboyUI class displays the busboy window which shows the map of the tables for the restaurant and their respective status. If a table is dirty (red) then the busboy can click on it after they have cleaned it to change the status to unoccupied (green). The status is updated for all of the employees working on the floor, and the host can see that the table is ready to be seated.

Author:
Kalev Roomann-Kurrik

Constructor Detail

BusboyUI

public BusboyUI()
This is the constructor for the BusboyUI class and is called whenever a new busboy window is needed. It generates the window, and displays the up to date map of the restaurant, including the status of every table.

Method Detail

cleanTable

public void cleanTable(Table aTable)
This method is called whenever a busboy clicks on a dirty table. The status of the table is first checked in the actionListener for when a busboy clicks on a table. This method calls a method in the Busboy Account class that sets the status of the table to unoccupied (green) which is then updated on the map of tables for the restaurant.

Parameters:
aTable - The table that was just cleaned

logout

public void logout()
This method is called whenever a busboy clicks on the logout button. It will close the BusboyUI window, and bring back the login window.
